title: Setting up Continuous Integration with Jenkins
prerequisites: Understanding of the software development process.
Bring your own computer where you installed and where you have the rights to install new software.
objectives: Understand the role of Continuous Integration in the life-cycle of software projects.
Create simple Jenkins jobs with and without pipelines
course_format: 8 academic hours. (Two half-days or a full day)
language: The course is given in Hebrew with slides and materials in English.

syllabus.title: Install Jenkins master
entries: Install Jenkins on a local Linux system or on a cloud based VPS.
Install the default plugins
Install additional plugins
Configuration of Jenkins
Backup of Jenkins
User administration in Jenkins

syllabus.title: Create a simple Jenkins Job
entries: Create a Jenkins job that runs a shell script on Unix
Schedule a job based on polling.
Schedule a job based on timer.
Schedule a job based on trigger.

syllabus.title: Create a Pipeline job
entries: Create a job using Pipelines manually
Add several stages to the pipeline
Use plugins to enhance the pipeline
Sequencial and parallel steps in a Jenkins pipeline
Post stages of pipelines
The pipeline editor
Blue Ocean

syllabus.title: Install Jenkins agent
entries: Install Jenkins agent
Configure jobs to run on the agent
Limit the number of processes on the agent

syllabus.title: Introduction to Groovy
entries: Basic Groovy commands that can be used in Jenkins pipelines

syllabus.title: Jenkins and Git
entries: Connecting Git and Jenkins
Running Jenkins from Git
